name: Château d'Angers
notes: Walls nearly 2,000 feet (610 m) in circumference, incorporating 17 towers originally 130 feet (40 m) high.

name: Château de Brissac
notes: Damaged during French Wars of Religion, rebuilt 1611 in baroque style.

name: Château de Montreuil-Bellay
notes: Divided into rental units in 1822, restored after 1860.

name: Château de Montsoreau
notes: Ruinous by late 19th century, restored, houses the Musee des Goums Marocains.

name: Château du Plessis-Bourre
notes: Externally unchanged since the 15th century, working drawbridge.

name: Château de Pouance
notes: Considered second fortress of Anjou, after Angers.

name: Château de Saumur
notes: Page for September in the Tres Riches Heures du Duc de Berry depicts the Chateau as it looked in 1410.

name: Château de la Turmeliere
notes: 19th century building of same name nearby.
